diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Familial Short Stature Caused by Haploinsufficiency of the Insulin-Like Growth Factor I Receptor
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was based on the identification of a novel heterozygous 19-nucleotide duplication mutation in the IGF1R gene, which led to haploinsufficiency of the IGF1R protein due to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay. Family history of short stature and clinical findings indicating growth retardation further supported the diagnosis.
